title: Add caching for code search results
description:
Implement disk-based caching for parsed AST and search results to improve performance.

## Objective
Cache parsed ASTs and search indices to avoid re-parsing on every search.

## Implementation Details
- Use diskcache library (already used by Aider)
- Cache parsed ASTs per file (keyed by path + mtime)
- Cache symbol tables per directory
- Invalidate on file modification
- Store in ~/.consoul/search-cache/

## Technical Approach
1. Add diskcache to dependencies
2. Create cache manager class
3. Integrate with code_search module
4. Add cache versioning
5. Implement cache cleanup/limits

## Code Structure


## Acceptance Criteria
- First search slow, subsequent fast
- Cache invalidates on file changes
- Cache size limited (configurable)
- Cache versioned for upgrades
- Thread-safe operations
- Performance: >10x improvement on cache hit

## Testing
- Test cache hit/miss
- Test invalidation on mtime change
- Test size limits
- Test concurrent access
- Benchmark performance improvement

## Documentation
- Cache behavior in docs

- Cache management commands
